result.execSummary:
The defendant Mick Alan Braley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP as soon as possible.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain or maintain full time employment.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 10-2-15
Pay DNA surcharge.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users, other than in treatment.

Undergo assessments, treatments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Once a month during extended supervision, defendant must speak to young people about THC and alcohol.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
